characters.name: King Anubis
characters.description: The jackal king of ancient Anugypt in Friendship is Magic Issue #24. He is also a character in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as a boss with a story role during the "Nightmare Night at the Museum" and "Reflections of Harmony" events. His bio states, "Supreme Pharaoh of the Lost Civilization of Anugypt, this jackal tyrant was undone by a group of rebellious cats. (It's a long story.)" In concept art he appears with a quadrupedal design.

The Boss
Charlie
characters.description: Addressed on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #47 page 3. In The Official Movie Sourcebook.â€‹[â€‹specifyâ€‹]â€‹

characters.name: Fido
characters.description: Diamond Dogs are a group of dog creatures who first appear as the antagonists of the episode A Dog and Pony Show, led by the three dogs Rover, Fido, and Spot. After they see Rarity using her gem-finding spell, they kidnap her and force her to find gems for them. They are not particularly smart, allowing Rarity to trick them with ease. Their human counterparts appear in the Rainbow Rocks animated short Player Piano and make cameo appearances in My Little Pony Equestria Girls: Rainbow Rocks and My Little Pony Equestria Girls: Friendship Games.

characters.name: Jim
characters.description: A Diamond Dog who appears in Friends Forever Issue #6 as chancellor to Queen Trixianna the First. [1]â€‹[â€‹specifyâ€‹]â€‹

characters.name: Pharaohnic Guard
characters.description: Jackal design used in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #24, Issue #53, and My Little Pony: Nightmare Knights (multiple). Also used for a character in Gameloft's mobile game, whose bio states, "Loyal defenders of Pharoah Cleopatrot -- when they aren't trying to define their own personal sense of style." They serve as enemy minions during the "Nightmare Night at the Museum" and "Wonderbolt for a Day" events.

characters.description: Diamond Dogs are a group of dog creatures who first appear as the antagonists of the episode A Dog and Pony Show, led by the three dogs Rover, Fido, and Spot. characters.name: Dr. Wolf
characters.description: An original character of Brent Wilson, featured on the back cover of the My Little Pony - Equestria Girls: The Specials Region 2 DVD in a YouTube video thumbnail.

characters.name: Albus
characters.description: Braeburn's pet dog. Applejack mentions in Fluttershy and the Fine Furry Friends Fair that he comes in last place every year at the Furry Friends Fair.

characters.name: Bruno
characters.description: Yollotl's pet puppy who goes missing in Daring Do and the Marked Thief of Marapore.

characters.name: Bunny
characters.description: Prince Blueblood's pet dog in My Little Pony: Deviations.

characters.name: Garth
characters.description: Mentioned in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #70 as the pet dog of Achin, a member of the Apple family.

characters.name: Pearl
characters.description: Spring Song's pet white pooch in Fluttershy and the Fine Furry Friends Fair.

characters.name: Reba
characters.description: Icy Shanks' pet dog in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #67.

characters.name: Ripley
characters.description: Zipporwhill's pet dog in Filli Vanilli and Forever Filly. Named after Jim Miller's female pet lab/border collie cross.

characters.name: Ripley
characters.description: Cromwell's pet border collie in Fluttershy and the Fine Furry Friends Fair.

characters.name: Sandra
characters.description: One of the animals at Fluttershy's Sweet Feather Sanctuary in She Talks to Angel.

characters.name: Scout
characters.description: Corral's pet dog in Fluttershy and the Fine Furry Friends Fair.

characters.name: Winona
characters.description: Winona is Applejack's pet and work dog. She first appears in Applebuck Season helping Applejack round up a stampeding herd of cattle. Unlike the Diamond Dogs, Winona only barks and does not speak in any of her appearances. She has a red collar with a golden name tag.

characters.name: Cerberus
characters.description: Cerberus is a giant three-headed dog that first appears in the episode It's About Time. He is responsible for guarding the gates of Tartarus.

characters.description: A Timberwolf in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #73.

characters.name: S02E12 Unnamed Timberwolf

characters.name: S04E22 Unnamed Orthros
characters.description:
My Little Pony Friendship is Magic hosts an array of creatures that have a counterpart in both mythology and fantasy, some of which are far more removed from their realistic counterpart than usual animals.

A few creatures, like dragons and Diamond Dogs, have speaking roles and display sapience when interacting with the protagonists. Others behave more like animals and neither speak nor display sapience. While most beings are from real-life known myths and legends, others are completely original and made up for the show, such as breezies.

characters.name: Issue 61 Unnamed Diamond Dog
characters.description: A Diamond Dog who appears in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #61.
